==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|type=22}}

===Etymology===
Literally "Princess of Peace". But it can be translated even more literally to "Extremely Flat Princess", thus its use in slang to refer to flat-chested woman.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=Tàipíng Gōngzhǔ,tàipíng gōngzhǔ
|cat=pn,n
}}

===Proper noun===
{{zh-proper noun}}

# {{w|Princess Taiping}} (665-773), a princess of the {{w|Tang Dynasty}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|slang}} a [[flat-chested]] [[woman]]

====Synonyms====
* {{zh-l|飛機場}} airport (slang for flat chest)
* {{zh-l|航空母艦}} aircraft carrier (slang for flat chest)

====Antonyms====
* {{zh-l|爆乳}} slang for large chest
